editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Psalter. F-162v: 151 Psalms of David. The word for God is not rubricated. The midpoint of the Psalnms () is unmarked. Psalm 76 employs the small number for 6. The spiritual meanings of the Hebrew letters in Psalm 118 are listed for only the first four letters. Psalm 151 is in the long version. F-179v: Biblical Canticles. The fourth biblical canticle is Prayer of Hana, mother of Samuel. Columetric layout is only in the 10th biblical canticle and not in Psalm 150 or Psalm 148. F-187v: Song of Songs, in the common version. 188r-198r: Praises of Mary, arranged for the days of the week: Monday (188r), Tuesday (189r), Wednesday (190v), Thursday (192r), Friday(194v), Saturday (195v), Sunday (196v). F-202r: Gate of Light. Varia: : Asmat prayer against Barya, written in a later hand. Tooled leather covers (much of which is lost), with colored cloth visible between the paste downs.
